title: 111_hr1650
content: The Act is titled the "Troubled Asset Relief Program Enhancement Act" and aims to enhance oversight of the TARP. The Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 is amended to include public accountability for actions taken by entities participating in programs established under the Act. Subsection (a)(2) is also revised to redesignate subparagraphs and update language regarding oversight of the Troubled Asset Relief Program. The Comptroller General shall have access to all information and records related to the Troubled Asset Relief Program for review purposes. The Comptroller General has access to information and records related to the Troubled Asset Relief Program, including verification of transactions and the ability to make and retain copies of books and records. The Comptroller General has access to contracts, agreements, and records related to the Troubled Asset Relief Program, with restrictions on public disclosure of proprietary information. The Comptroller General has access to secret information under this section, with exceptions for congressional committees and prohibitions against disclosure of trade secrets or other prohibited information. Authorization of appropriation is also included. Authorization of appropriation is authorized to cover additional expenses for the Comptroller General under the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 for fiscal years 2010 and 2011, not to exceed $5,000,000.
